page.title: 12STOKE CLIMSLAND SCHOOL
page.content: THE SCHOOL 1S{BUILT ON LAND SOLD BY {THE CHURCH IN 1851.}THE{NATIONAL {SOCIETY}PROVIDED FINANCE TO BUILD {THREE SCHOOL ROOMS}AND A TEACHER'S HOUSE. IN{1876}THE RECTOR OF STOKE CHURCH HAD THE{SCHOOL TRANSFERED FROM THE{NATIONAL SOCIETY TO THE STOKE {CLIMSLAND SCHOOL BOARD.}THE{FIRST {HEADMASTER}RECORDED IS{MR.T MUTTEN.}HE CAME TO STOKE IN{1882}AND REMAINED FOR {40 YEARS. MR.T.OATES}REPLACED HIM IN {1922,}FINALLY{LEAVING}IN{1940.}DURING THE WAR EVACUATION YEARS IT WAS FOUND NECESSARY TO{REOPEN}THE SCHOOL AT {LUCKETT. MR.W.LEE}WAS IN CHARGE AT LUCKETT AND STOKE AND REMAINED AT LUCKETT UNTIL THE SCHOOL CLOSED FOR THE LAST TIME IN 1947. MR. C.F.CARDEW REPLACED MR. HILL AND STAYED UNTIL RETIREMENT IN 1972. HE WAS REPLACED BY MR.C.M. BRAY, WHO WAS HEADMASTER UNTIL MR D.F BUNDY WAS APPOINTED IN 1979.
